Dear God, can't you people separate your personal, anecdotal experiences, from the aggregate data that is accumulated by the studies. Have you not heard the phrase """"exception to the rule."""" I'm glad your formula fed baby is smart, but that doesn't negate the conclusions drawn from the study. The inability to recognize this is incredibly self centered and reflects a serious lack of critical thinking ability.

That's funny, I don't see them being ignored. The Jewish people have their holidays, and are able to take them off as legal holidays. In fact, when my kids were in school, their """"holiday"""" play included Hanukkah and Kwanzaa and their REAL meanings, yet left out the true meaning of Christmas. They only correlated Christmas with Santa and Rudolph. You can go to the store and find things for those religions. But, this has been a primarily Judeau-Christian nation. The courts were decorated with The Ten Commandments and our dollars embellished with In God We Trust. What I do see is an all-out assault on Christianity and anything correlating to Christmas as a Christian holiday. Sad that there are people so offended by the birth of Jesus, the savior, but it was foretold that this would happen. Oh, and for the record, I wouldn't file a complaint if a teacher had a Kwanzaa decoration displayed or if Hindu had one displayed. It doesn't offend me that they choose to practice or celebrate their religion and holidays. My celebration shouldn't offend them.

Bo needs a history lesson...when he was shown in the White House kitchen with the beer he brewed, he said that the only other President who brewed beer in the White House was George Washington...Bo, FYI..George Washington never lived in the WH,,it wasn't built when he was President... if George Bush had made that mistake, the liberal main stream media would have plastered his mistake all over the papers and on TV...

The study isn't just about social media. It's about listening to music, watching TV, playing video games, and using social media. You can't complain about social media and then turn around and let your kid watch TV for 4 hours a night or play video games until it's bed time. None of this stuff is bad in moderation. My daughter plays Minecraft, listens to music, reads books, plays outside, and watches TV on top of being active in karate and now swimming. Before you knock on the habits of teens, take a look at yourself. My newsfeed is constantly full of people saying they binged watched 2 seasons of some show on Netflix.

I'm sorry you had to deal with stupid security officers and store owners... ; however, maybe that Asian salon owner wasn't being racist but rather did not have the education to cut coarser hair and was knowledgeable enough to know where her skills lacked ability. I've had terrible haircuts because the stylist didn't have the knowledge to cut my funky asian hair and didn't inform me of that. Unfortunately not all salon schools or hair stylists learn to cut all types of hair. If she was being racist I'm sorry. Personally i wouldn't want to support her business because either she's racist or needs more training.
